Markov Chain Basic $X_n$ state after $n$ transitions belongs to a finite set initial state $X_0$ either given or random transition probabilities: \[\begin{aligned} p_{i j} & =\mathbf{P}\left(X_1=j \mid X_0=i\right) \\ & =\mathbf{P}\left(X_{n+1}=j \mid X_n=i\right) \end{aligned}\] Markov property/assumption: “given current state, the past doesn’t matter” \(\begin{aligned} p_{i j} & =\mathbf{P}\left(X_{n+1}=j \mid...

Pure Monte Carlo (MCMC) sampling Importance Sampling — Using sampling to approximate a distribution \(E[f(x)] = \int f(x)p(x) dx \approx \frac{1}{n}\sum_{i} f(x_i)\) where $ x \sim p(x)$ \[E[f(x)] = \int f(x)p(x) dx = \int f(x)\frac{p(x)}{q(x)}q(x) dx \approx \frac{1}{n} \sum_{i} f(x_i)\frac{p(x_i)}{q(x_i)}\] where $ x \sim q(x)$ Idea of importance sampling: draw...
